verses.verse: (Is. 52:15; Eph. 2:11, 12) Surely you shall call a nation you do not know, (Is. 60:5) And nations who do not know you shall run to you, Because of the LORD your God, And the Holy One of Israel; (Is. 60:9) For He has glorified you.”
(Matt. 5:25; 25:11; John 7:34; 8:21; 2 Cor. 6:2; (Heb. 3:13)) Seek the LORD while He may be (Ps. 32:6; Is. 49:8) found, Call upon Him while He is near.

(Is. 1:16) Let the wicked forsake his way, And the unrighteous man (Is. 59:7; Zech. 8:17) his thoughts; Let him return to the LORD, (Ps. 130:7; Jer. 3:12) And He will have mercy on him; And to our God, For He will abundantly pardon.
“For (2 Sam. 7:19) My thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor are your ways My ways,” says the LORD.
“For (Ps. 103:11) as the heavens are higher than the earth, So are My ways higher than your ways, And My thoughts than your thoughts.

“For (Deut. 32:2) as the rain comes down, and the snow from heaven, And do not return there, But water the earth, And make it bring forth and bud, That it may give seed to the sower And bread to the eater,

(Is. 45:23; Matt. 24:35) So shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth; It shall not return to Me void, But it shall accomplish what I please, And it shall (Is. 46:9-11) prosper in the thing for which I sent it.

“For (Is. 35:10) you shall go out with joy, And be led out with peace; The mountains and the hills Shall (Ps. 98:8) break forth into singing before you, And (1 Chr. 16:33) all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.

(Is. 41:19) Instead of (Mic. 7:4) the thorn shall come up the cypress tree, And instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree; And it shall be to the LORD (Jer. 13:11) for a name, For an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.”

Salvation for the Gentiles Thus says the LORD: “Keep justice, and do righteousness, (Is. 46:13; Matt. 3:2; 4:17; Rom. 13:11, 12) For My salvation is about to come, And My righteousness to be revealed.

Blessed is the man who does this, And the son of man who lays hold on it; (Ex. 20:8-11; 31:13-17; Is. 58:13; Jer. 17:21, 22; Ezek. 20:12, 20) Who keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And keeps his hand from doing any evil.”

Do not let (Is. 14:1; (Eph. 2:12-19)) the son of the foreigner Who has joined himself to the LORD Speak, saying, “The LORD has utterly separated me from His people”; Nor let the (Deut. 23:1; Jer. 38:7; Acts 8:27) eunuch say, “Here I am, a dry tree.”
